opennlp.ccg.synsem
Class SyntacticFeatureExtractor

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.synsem.SyntacticFeatureExtractor
All Implemented Interfaces:
FeatureExtractor
public class SyntacticFeatureExtractor
extends Object
implements FeatureExtractor

A class for extracting generic features from derivations, inspired by those in the C&C-07 normal form model. Features are extracted lazily for efficiency.

Version:
$Revision: 1.10 $, $Date: 2011/11/08 14:58:15 $
Author:
Michael White

protected  void addFeatures(Sign sign, boolean complete)
          Recursively adds features to the feature map for the given sign, if not already present.
protected  String distPuncts()
          Returns the distance in intervening punctuation marks as 0p, 1p, 2p or 3p (for 3 or more).

          Returns the distance in intervening verbs as 0v, 1v, or 2v (for 2 or more).

distPuncts

protected String distPuncts()
Returns the distance in intervening punctuation marks as 0p, 1p, 2p or 3p (for 3 or more).

isPunct

protected boolean isPunct(Word word)
Returns whether a word is a punctuation mark that typically signals sentence-internal complexity. The default implementation tests for commas, dashes (--), semi-colons and colons.

distVerbs

protected String distVerbs()
Returns the distance in intervening verbs as 0v, 1v, or 2v (for 2 or more).

isVerb

protected boolean isVerb(Word word)
Returns whether a word is a verb. The default implementation tests for a POS tag beginning with V.
